meanings.sent1: She accidentally runkled her shirt while folding it.
meanings.sent2: The paper runkled as she crumpled it up.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy runkled the blanket while playing.
meanings.sent4: Time runkles memories like old photographs in a dusty album.
meanings.sent5: The old book's pages runkled from years of use, telling stories of the past.

meanings.definition: A wrinkle or crease in fabric or skin
meanings.sent1: The runkle in his shirt showed it had not been ironed.
meanings.sent2: She smoothed out the runkle in the bedsheet before making the bed.
meanings.sent3: The runkle in the carpet made it difficult to vacuum properly.
meanings.sent4: The runkle in time revealed the history of the ancient parchment.
meanings.sent5: The runkle on her forehead deepened with each passing year, marking the passage of time.
